title: Coronation Street spoilers: Special episodes revealed for Sinead's death
text:
After learning that she only has a limited amount of time left to live, Sinead Tinker (Katie McGlynn) is determined to make the most what time she’s got left and, with the end is approaching, Coronation Street has revealed that her storyline will culminate at the end of next week in two special episodes.

Sinead was left devastated several months back when — on the day of her wedding to Daniel (Rob Mallard) — Beth (Lisa George) discovered a lump on the back of her neck. The following day, the young mum went to the hospital, and it was here that she learned that her cancer had not only returned, but that — this time — it’s terminal.

Since then, Sinead and Daniel have done everything they can to enjoy what little time they’ve got left together, but they were left further heartbroken last week when — after an appointment with the oncologist — they discovered that Sinead only has a matter of weeks left to live.

Sinead will attempt to make the most of her time left, and her friends and family rally round her to make her final few days incredibly special, before they’re forced to bid a final farewell to her. Coronation Street has revealed that Sinead’s life will come to an end at the end of next week in two incredibly moving episodes focusing solely on the final day of her life.

A half-hour episode — which will be broadcast on Thursday 24th October — before a special one hour instalment on Friday 25th October, and both will centre on Sinead having to come to terms with the fact that she will never see her son Bertie grow up, while Daniel will be forced to say goodbye to his one true love, before facing the prospect of life as a single father.

On his time with working with Katie McGlynn, actor Rob said: ‘Daniel and Sinead’s relationship has been so believable and real. I find it quite difficult to switch off after emotional scenes, I feel so drained after a scene that’s involved a lot of crying. I guess the grieving process you see on screen will be a lot easier to play because Daniel’s sad that Sinead’s gone, and I’m devastated that Katie’s gone.’

Katie said: ‘When we filmed our last scenes it felt real. I know what a terrific actor Rob is and how he’s going to play the next part of this story without me, and I just feel sorry for Daniel’s character. It’s going to be the end of an era because I’ve really enjoyed working with him.’

Sinead’s final Coronation Street episodes will air on Thursday 24th October and Friday 25th October.
